original: 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa yod na nges par de bzhin du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa yod na nges par de bzhin du 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the conditions for the occurrence of the opposites are present, they will certainly occur.

original: sems 'dis nges par 'dor ba ni yang dag par spong ba ste /
analyzed: sems 'dis nges par 'dor ba ni yang dag par spong ba ste /
translated: The mind is definitely to be relinquished through the four right efforts.

original: de dag ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: They are of four kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do //üîΩ'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed do // 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: One generates will for the non-arising of evil unwholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin to //üîΩyang dag par 'jog go//
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin to // yang dag par 'jog go//
translated: One makes effort, one exerts energy, one exerts the mind, one strives.üîΩOne generates will for the abandonment of evil unwholesome dharmas that have already arisen.üîΩOne generates will for the arising of wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: de bzhin du skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / 'phel bar bya ba dang / phyir zhing 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / 'phel bar bya ba dang / phyir zhing 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One generates will for the abiding, non-forgetting, repeated cultivation, increase, growth, extension, and fulfilment of wholesome dharmas that have already arisen.

original: de la 'dun pa bskyed pa ni go cha'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa bskyed pa ni go cha'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: Among them, the generation of will is armor-like effort.

original: de ltar 'bad pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: de ltar 'bad pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI will strive in this way‚Äù is the effort of application.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni skye bo'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni skye bo'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort of beings is the undertaking of effort.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par 'jog pa ni thabs kyi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang / yang dag par 'jog pa ni thabs kyi brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort of means is the holding of the mind in check and the right establishment of the mind.

original: de las zhum pa la sems rab tu 'dzin pa'o //üîΩrgod pa la sems yang dag par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: de las zhum pa la sems rab tu 'dzin pa'o // rgod pa la sems yang dag par 'jog pa ste /
translated: The holding of the mind in check is for the sake of the mind that is slack.

original: mngon par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'jog pa'o //
translated: The right establishment of the mind is for the sake of the mind that is distracted.üîΩIt is the establishment of the mind in the object.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos so //
translated: The supernormal powers are the supramundane dharmas.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ste /
translated: The bases of the supernormal powers are the four bases of the supernormal powers.

original: gnas yin pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
analyzed: gnas yin pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'o //
translated: They are called bases because they are the basis of the supernormal powers.

original: de yang bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang bzhi ste /
translated: They are four in number.

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / sems kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The concentration of will, the concentration of energy, the concentration of mind, and the concentration of investigation.

original: 'di ltar kha cig ni sems 'dun pa drag pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kha cig ni sems 'dun pa drag pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, for some, concentration, which is characterized by the one-pointedness of mind, arises through the possession of intense will.

original: kha cig gi yang dag par spong ba ni brtson 'grus dang shin tu ldan pas mi dge ba yang dag par spangs te dge ba'i chos skyed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: kha cig gi yang dag par spong ba ni brtson 'grus dang shin tu ldan pas mi dge ba yang dag par spangs te dge ba'i chos skyed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: For some, it is through the possession of vigor and the abandonment of nonvirtue, and the generation of virtuous qualities.

original: kha cig gi ni zhi @110b gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan dag gis sems yongs su sbyangs pa las so //
analyzed: kha cig gi ni zhi @110b gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu mtshan dag gis sems yongs su sbyangs pa las so //
translated: For some, it is through the purification of the mind by means of the signs of serenity, control, and equanimity.üîΩFor some, it is through the thorough analysis of oneself, asking:

original: kha cig ni ci bdag mi dge ba phra mo la kun tu mi spyod dam /
analyzed: kha cig ni ci bdag mi dge ba phra mo la kun tu mi spyod dam /
translated: ‚ÄúAm I not engaging in even the slightest nonvirtue?

original: ci yang kun tu mi spyod ces gang bdag nyid la /
analyzed: ci yang kun tu mi spyod ces gang bdag nyid la /
translated: Am I not engaging in anything at all?‚Äù

original: yongs su dpyod pa ni yang dag par nye bar dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dpyod pa ni yang dag par nye bar dpyod pa'o //
translated: This is thorough analysis.

original: de dag skyes pa la kun nas dkris pa ni ring du gyur la /
analyzed: de dag skyes pa la kun nas dkris pa ni ring du gyur la /
translated: When these have arisen, the fetters are far away,

original: bag la nyal rnams spang ba'i phyir yang yang dag par spong ba rtsom pa ni spong ba 'du byed pa brgyad mngon par 'byung ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal rnams spang ba'i phyir yang yang dag par spong ba rtsom pa ni spong ba 'du byed pa brgyad mngon par 'byung ste /
translated: and in order to abandon the latent states, one again undertakes the abandonment, and the eight applications of abandonment arise.

original: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: intention, andüîΩequanimity.

original: de la gang gi tshe 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed par bya snyam pa ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bskyed par bya snyam pa ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: Here, will-power is the desire to generate the mundane and supramundane meditative concentrations.

original: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad nges par 'joms pa ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos thams cad nges par 'joms pa ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: Striving is the definite overcoming of all unwholesome states.

original: dad pa ni bla ma'i chos rtogs pa la bya'o ;
analyzed: dad pa ni bla ma'i chos rtogs pa la bya'o ;
translated: Faith is the understanding of the Dharma of the teacher.

original: / de'i sngon du 'gro ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: / de'i sngon du 'gro ba ni shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Plianc—É is what precedes that.

original: de la yang dran pa ni shes bzhin gyi phyogs so //
analyzed: de la yang dran pa ni shes bzhin gyi phyogs so //
translated: Mindfulness is the side of awareness.

original: shes bzhin ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
translated: Awareness is the side of insight.

original: de la sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: Intention is the mental activity of the mind.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni btang snyoms so //
translated: Equanimity is the absence of afflictions.

original: de 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed de /
analyzed: de 'dun pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgom par byed de /
translated: He cultivates the foot of spiritual power that is concentration accompanied by the volition of striving, etc.

original: dben pa ni nyon mongs pa las so //
analyzed: dben pa ni nyon mongs pa las so //
translated: Isolation is from the defilements.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni srid pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni srid pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: Freedom from passion is from the passion of existence.

original: 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Cessation is from suffering.

original: de dag la bstan nas rnam par spong ba ni sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: de dag la bstan nas rnam par spong ba ni sdug bsngal te /
translated: The abandonment of those is suffering.

original: de dag la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la brten pa'o //
translated: They are based on those.

original: de'i phyir yongs su grub pa sgom mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su grub pa sgom mo //
translated: Therefore, he cultivates the perfected.

original: mchog tu dbang byed pas na dbang po ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dbang byed pas na dbang po ste /
translated: The faculties are so called because they exercise supreme control.

original: dad pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: They are the five beginning with faith.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skyed cing thob pa la bdag por gyur pas na dbang po ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos skyed cing thob pa la bdag por gyur pas na dbang po ste /
translated: The faculties are so called because they exercise control over the generation and acquisition of supramundane dharmas.

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang ; ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang ; ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: They are the faculty of faith, the faculty of energy, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang ldan pa'i rtags mthong ba las phyis khyad par can du 'byung ba la nges pa skye ba'i phyir ston pa dang nyan thos de dag gi rtogs pa la dad pa skye ba de ni 'di'i dad pa'i dbang po'o //üîΩdad pa lhag pas @111a * //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang ldan pa'i rtags mthong ba las phyis khyad par can du 'byung ba la nges pa skye ba'i phyir ston pa dang nyan thos de dag gi rtogs pa la dad pa skye ba de ni 'di'i dad pa'i dbang po'o // dad pa lhag pas @111a * //
translated: The faculty of faith is the faith in the realization of the Master and the disciples, which arises from seeing the signs of the possession of the bases of psychic power, and from the certainty that they will later become superior.

original: na brtson 'grus la sogs pa yang lhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: na brtson 'grus la sogs pa yang lhag par 'gyur te /
translated: Since faith is predominant, so too are vigor, etc.

original: des na dbang po lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dbang po lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are five faculties.

original: de ltar dbang po sgom pa na bdud la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir dad pa'i stobs nas shas rab kyi bar ro //üîΩbyang chub ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste /üîΩdran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbang po sgom pa na bdud la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir dad pa'i stobs nas shas rab kyi bar ro // byang chub ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub ste / dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag nas /
translated: When one cultivates the faculties in this way, they become the powers, because they are not overwhelmed by any opposing factors, such as the mƒÅras.üîΩEnlightenment is the path of insight, which is the realization of the way things truly are.

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi bar du'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi bar du'o //
translated: It is the perfect enlightenment of the members of enlightenment, from the member of enlightenment of mindfulness up to the member of enlightenment of equanimity.

original: de la chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
analyzed: de la chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
translated: Among them, the investigation of phenomena, effort, and joy are on the side of insight.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
translated: Calmness, concentration, and equanimity are on the side of serenity.

original: dran pa ni gnyi ga'i phyogs so //
analyzed: dran pa ni gnyi ga'i phyogs so //
translated: Mindfulness is on the side of both.

original: des de dag thob pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs par bdag nyid kyis mthong nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag spong ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad phung po gsum du sgom par byed do //
analyzed: des de dag thob pas mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs par bdag nyid kyis mthong nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag spong ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad phung po gsum du sgom par byed do //
translated: Having attained them, he sees himself as having abandoned the afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing. In order to abandon those that are to be abandoned by cultivation, he cultivates the eightfold noble path in three groups.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i brtson pa ni shes rab kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i brtson pa ni shes rab kyi phung po'o //
translated: Among them, right view, right thought, and right effort are the aggregate of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / tshor ba ni tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / tshor ba ni tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
translated: Right speech, right action, and right livelihood are the aggregate of morality.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //
translated: Right mindfulness and right concentration are the concentration aggregate.

original: 'phags pa ni slob pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni slob pa rnams so //
translated: The noble ones are the trainees.

original: de dag gis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir dang / rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa slob pa'i lam 'di skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni nyon mongs pa thams cad spang ba'i phyir dang / rnam par grol ba mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir 'phags pa slob pa'i lam 'di skyed par byed do //
translated: They generate this noble path of the trainees in order to abandon all the defilements and in order to manifest liberation.

original: de bas na 'di 'phags pa rnams kyi yan lag brgyad yin pas na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
analyzed: de bas na 'di 'phags pa rnams kyi yan lag brgyad yin pas na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
translated: Therefore, since these are the eight limbs of the noble ones, they are the noble path with eight limbs.

original: de dag ni dan pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni dan pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: These are the four establishments of mindfulness and so on.

original: sde tshan bdun re rer rnam par dbye ba byas nas byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sde tshan bdun re rer rnam par dbye ba byas nas byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: When each of these seven groups is divided, they become the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes so//
analyzed: byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes so//
translated: Enlightenment is the wisdom of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs so //
translated: That which is in accordance with that is a factor of enlightenment.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ste /
translated: The three concentrations are the three doors of liberation.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kun brtags pa de'i ngo bo gtan du med pas des stong pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kun brtags pa de'i ngo bo gtan du med pas des stong pa'o //
translated: The imagined reality is empty of that, since it is utterly nonexistent in its own nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni brjod du med pas mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni brjod du med pas mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: The perfected reality is signless, since it is inexpressible.

original: des na mtshan @111b ma med pa'o //üîΩgzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: des na mtshan @111b ma med pa'o // gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is signless.üîΩThe relative reality is void, since it is the root of error.

original: med pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the root of error, since it appears as an existent reality.

original: 'khrul pa'i rtsa ba yang nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rtsa ba yang nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: The root of error is the addictive reality,

original: de'i phyir de ni spang bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni spang bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: therefore, it is to be abandoned.

original: smon par 'os pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: smon par 'os pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not suitable for aspiration,

original: des na smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: des na smon pa med pa'o //
translated: therefore, it is without aspiration.

original: shes pa bcu gcig ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: shes pa bcu gcig ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: The eleven knowledges are as in the sutra.

original: sdug bsngal mi skye bar shes pa ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba mi skye ba ste de shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi skye bar shes pa ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba mi skye ba ste de shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the nonarising of suffering is the nonarising of the occurrence of suffering.

original: spangs pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi bdag nyid nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs pa ste de shes pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi bdag nyid nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs pa ste de shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of elimination is the knowledge of the elimination of the afflictions, etc., which have the nature of the truth of origin.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dag 'gog pa ste de shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa shes pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dag 'gog pa ste de shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the truth of suffering‚Äôs cessation is the knowledge of the cessation of suffering.

original: 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba de lam gang gis 'gog pa mngon sum du byed pa ni de'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba de lam gang gis 'gog pa mngon sum du byed pa ni de'i shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the path by which one realizes cessation is the knowledge of the path.

original: 'dis sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of the path that realizes the cessation of suffering.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa shes pa ni zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa shes pa ni zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of elimination is the knowledge of the exhaustion of attachment and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa mi skye ba shes pa ni mi skye bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa mi skye ba shes pa ni mi skye bar shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of nonarising is the knowledge that attachment and so on will not arise again.

original: rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa shes pa ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the realization of liberation is Dharma knowledge.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de rjes su dpag pas shes pa ni rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de rjes su dpag pas shes pa ni rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of subsequent states is the knowledge of impermanence and so on that is inferred from that.

original: gcig tu kun brtags pa la dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu kun brtags pa la dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of others‚Äô minds is conventional knowledge because it focuses on the imputed nature alone.

original: lam la 'dris pa ni lam la goms pa'o //
analyzed: lam la 'dris pa ni lam la goms pa'o //
translated: Familiarity with the path is the cultivation of the path.

original: sgra ji bzhin shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang lha dang mi la sogs pa thams cad kyi skad shes pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang lha dang mi la sogs pa thams cad kyi skad shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the sounds is the knowledge of the speech of all the Tathagatas, gods, men, etc.

original: dbang po gsum ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: dbang po gsum ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: The three faculties are as in the sutra.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la bdag po yin pa'i phyir dbang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la bdag po yin pa'i phyir dbang po'o //
translated: They are faculties because they are the masters with regard to the purification of the dharmas.

original: dbang po gang la mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po gang la mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That faculty is so called because it is the master with regard to the production of the knowledge of what has not been known.

original: kun shes pa'i dbang po dang kun shes pa bsrung ba'i dbang po ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa'i dbang po dang kun shes pa bsrung ba'i dbang po ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of the possession of knowledge and the faculty of the protection of the possession of knowledge are the faculty of the possession of knowledge.

original: snang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i phyin ci log bzhi snang ba med pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang spros pa'i mtshan ma thams cad nub pas chos nyid tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i phyin ci log bzhi snang ba med pa'i phyir dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang spros pa'i mtshan ma thams cad nub pas chos nyid tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of appearance is because the four errors of the Sravakas, etc. do not appear, and because the Bodhisattvas, by the disappearance of all signs of conceptual proliferation, have an objective support which is merely the reality of dharmas.

original: dregs pa 'dul ba ni ji ltar 'os pa nyon mongs pa 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dregs pa 'dul ba ni ji ltar 'os pa nyon mongs pa 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Subjugation of the haughty is the subjugation of the defilements in whatever way is appropriate.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The three concentrations, with applied-thought and with sustained-thought, etc., are as in the sutra.üîΩThe ten recollections, of Buddha, etc., are as in the sutra.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa bcu ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //üîΩ@112a * // bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa ni 'jug pa'i sgrub par bstan pa'o //üîΩtshad med pa yang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i tshad med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa bcu ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no // @112a * // bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa ni 'jug pa'i sgrub par bstan pa'o // tshad med pa yang 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i tshad med pa bzhin no //
translated: The liberations and the others are as in the sutra.üîΩThe liberations, the totalities, and the bases of mastery are as in the sutra.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ni gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The eight liberations are: 1) the liberation of form-possessors perceiving forms, 2) the liberation of formlessnesses perceiving forms, 3) the pleasant liberation, 4) the liberation of the sphere of infinite space, 5) the liberation of the sphere of infinite consciousness, 6) the liberation of the sphere of nothingness, 7) the liberation of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and 8) the liberation of the cessation of perception and feeling.üîΩThe first is the liberation of form-possessors perceiving forms.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes bas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba ni rnam par thar ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes bas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba ni rnam par thar ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the liberation of formlessnesses perceiving forms.

original: sdug par mos pa ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sdug par mos pa ni rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the pleasant liberation.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni sprul pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: These three are pure because they are the antidote to the obscurations of emanation.

original: de la dang po gnyis ni mi sdug pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po gnyis ni mi sdug pa'o //
translated: The first two are ugly.

original: gsum pa ni sdug pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sdug pa'o //
translated: The third is beautiful.üîΩSome yogis, as the antidote to attachment to color, etc. in the desire realm, enter into meditative concentration that takes as its object internal sound, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa kha cig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por nang gi sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs nas de nyid kyi 'og tu phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs paüîΩla dmigs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa kha cig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i kha dog gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por nang gi sgra la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs nas de nyid kyi 'og tu phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa la dmigs te /
translated: After that, they take as their object external blue, etc.

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: and enter into the first meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i kha dog gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa de bstan te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i kha dog gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen por bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug pa de bstan te /
translated: The second meditative concentration is taught as the antidote to attachment to color, etc. in the first meditative concentration.

original: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni nang gi gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs can zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya ba ni nang gi gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs can zhes brjod do //
translated: ‚Äú Having form, they see forms‚Äù means that they are called ‚Äúhaving form‚Äù because they take as their object internal form.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs la lta ba zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called ‚Äúviewing form‚Äù because it takes external form as its object.

original: rnal 'byor ba la nang la mi dmigs pa nyid kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig la dmigs shing snga ma bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'am gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs pa yang brjod do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba la nang la mi dmigs pa nyid kyis phyi rol gyi dngos po la sogs pa 'ba' zhig la dmigs shing snga ma bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'am gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs pa yang brjod do //
translated: The yogi, by not taking the internal as his object, takes only external things as his object, and enters the first or second meditation as before.

original: de ni nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúhaving the perception of the absence of form internally, he views external forms.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du mi sdug pa rnam par sgom pas sems kyi rgyud zhum pa dga' bar bya ba'am /üîΩci bdag yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams sdug pa nyid du yid la byed pa na kha dog la 'dod chags la sogs pa skye'am zhes sad pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs la dmigs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi sdug pa rnam par sgom pas sems kyi rgyud zhum pa dga' bar bya ba'am / ci bdag yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs rnams sdug pa nyid du yid la byed pa na kha dog la 'dod chags la sogs pa skye'am zhes sad pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs la dmigs nas /
translated: In the same way, when the mind is depressed by the cultivation of the loathsome, one should gladden it.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa la sdug par mos par 'gyur zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa la sdug par mos par 'gyur zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Or, in order to test whether one generates attachment to color, etc., when one keeps in mind the pleasant forms, one should focus on pleasant forms and enter the fourth meditation, resolved on the pleasant.

original: de ni gzugs can gyi rnam par thar pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ni gzugs can gyi rnam par thar pa gsum mo //
translated: These are the three liberations with form.

original: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa la ni lnga ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa la ni lnga ste /
translated: The formless liberations are five.

original: nam mkha' mtha' las skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa nas /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' las skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa nas /
translated: The liberation called the sphere of infinite space,

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa @112b zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa @112b zhes bya ba'i rnam par thar pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the liberation called the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: de la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa gzugs med pa bzhi'i dag pa la ni de'i ro myang ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnam par thar ba ste /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa gzugs med pa bzhi'i dag pa la ni de'i ro myang ba'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnam par thar ba ste /
translated: Among them, the four formless liberations, beginning with the sphere of infinite space, are liberations because they are the counteractions to the obscurations consisting of relishing the formless.

original: zhi bar gnas ba zhes kyang brjod do //
analyzed: zhi bar gnas ba zhes kyang brjod do //
translated: They are also called peaceful abodes.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa yang thar pa dang rjes su mthun par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa yang thar pa dang rjes su mthun par gnas pa'o //
translated: The cessation of ideation and sensation is also a peaceful abode that is in conformity with liberation.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la rten cing langs nas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la rten cing langs nas sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa ste /
translated: It is the cessation of mind and mental activities that occurs in dependence on and is projected by the sphere of neither ideation nor non-ideation.

original: de'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa ste zhi bar gnas pa zhes kyang brjod do //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir rnam par thar pa ste zhi bar gnas pa zhes kyang brjod do //
translated: Liberation is the state of dwelling in peace, because it is the abandonment of the obscurations to that.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o //
translated: The nine serial absorptions are the four absorptions, the four formless states, and the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata are the power of knowledge of what is possible and what is not; the power of knowledge of the results of actions; the power of knowledge of various higher and lower faculties; the power of knowledge of various elements; the power of knowledge of various interests; the power of knowledge of paths that lead everywhere; the power of knowledge of the recollection of former lives; the power of knowledge of death and rebirth; the power of knowledge of the extinction of the outflows; and the power of knowledge of all aspects of the supernormal knowledges.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of the recollection of former existences,üîΩthe power of knowledge of death and rebirth,

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the power of knowledge of the termination of the outflows.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid mdo'i go rims ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid mdo'i go rims ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Their characteristics are in accordance with the order in the sutras.

original: gnas la yang gnas su gnas pa la yang gnas ma yin par rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa rnams las mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: gnas la yang gnas su gnas pa la yang gnas ma yin par rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa rnams las mi 'dod pa'i rnam par smin pa ni gnas so //
translated: One knows the basis as the basis and the non-basis as the non-basis means that the undesirable ripening from misdeeds is the basis.

original: 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The desirable is not the basis.

original: legs par spyod pa rnams las 'dod pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: legs par spyod pa rnams las 'dod pa ni gnas so //
translated: The desirable from good conduct is the basis.

original: mi 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: The undesirable is not the basis.

original: ser snas dbul pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: ser snas dbul pa ni gnas so //
translated: Poverty through stinginess is possible,

original: longs spyod chen po ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: but not great wealth.

original: sbyin pa las longs spyod chen po ni gnas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa las longs spyod chen po ni gnas so //
translated: Great wealth through generosity is possible,

original: dbul por gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbul por gyur ba ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: but not poverty.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis ngan 'gror skye ba ni gnas so //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyis ngan 'gror skye ba ni gnas so //
translated: Birth in an unfortunate realm through immorality is possible,

original: bde 'go ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde 'go ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: but not a happy rebirth.

original: tshul khrims kyi bde 'gror skye ba ni gnas so //üîΩngan 'gro @113a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bde 'gror skye ba ni gnas so // ngan 'gro @113a * //
translated: A happy rebirth through morality is possible,

original: ni gnas ma yin pa ste /üîΩde la sogs pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa rab tu mkhyen pa ni dag pa dang ma chags pa dang thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa ni phyin ci ma log par ro //
analyzed: ni gnas ma yin pa ste / de la sogs pa gnas dang gnas ma yin pa rab tu mkhyen pa ni dag pa dang ma chags pa dang thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyis de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa ni phyin ci ma log par ro //
translated: but not an unfortunate rebirth.üîΩThus, the knowledge of the possible and the impossible is pure, unattached, and unobstructed knowledge.

original: des na dag pa nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: des na dag pa nyid ces brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called the knowledge of reality as it is, because it is unmistaken.

original: gang dang gang yang dag pa zhes zlos pa ni chags pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: gang dang gang yang dag pa zhes zlos pa ni chags pa med par bstan to //
translated: The repetition of ‚Äúreality‚Äù shows that it is unattached.üîΩThe knowledge of the futureüîΩis the knowledge of the future.

original: rnam pa gang dang gang gis yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dang gang gis yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase in whatever way refers to the following.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa bstan to //
translated: The term ‚Äúin every way‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúin every way‚Äù indicates that the knowledge is unobstructed because it is the knowledge of all modes.

original: ye shes de nyid stobs te gtan du gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i phyir dang gtan du gzhan dag zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ye shes de nyid stobs te gtan du gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i phyir dang gtan du gzhan dag zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: That knowledge is a power because it is always invincible by others and always victorious over others.

original: /'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir gnas dang rgyu zhes bya ba ni gnas dang rgyu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: /'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'dir gnas dang rgyu zhes bya ba ni gnas dang rgyu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the past, etc.‚Äù refers to the place and cause.

original: phyogs gang du de'i las byed pa de ni gnas so //
analyzed: phyogs gang du de'i las byed pa de ni gnas so //
translated: The place is the place where the action is performed.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa gang gi rgyu de'i las te rgyud dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa gang gi rgyu de'i las te rgyud dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The cause is the cause of the action, such as the disciples, etc.

original: rnam par smin pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //üîΩkhams sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o // khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The result is the ripening of the action, such as pleasure and pain.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe variety of constituent natures‚Äù is the teaching.

original: khams du ma zhes bya ba ni rjes su bstan pa'o //
analyzed: khams du ma zhes bya ba ni rjes su bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe many constituent natures‚Äù is the explanation.

original: khams ni lhag pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: khams ni lhag pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: The constituent nature is the superior attitude.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of the generation of merit, demerit, and stability.

original: mos pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dod pa ni mos pa ste //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'dod pa ni mos pa ste //
translated: Various inclinations means that here inclination is desire.

original: dper na chags pa la gnas pa yang zhe sdang la mos pa dang / zhe sdang la gnas pa yang chags pa la mos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na chags pa la gnas pa yang zhe sdang la mos pa dang / zhe sdang la gnas pa yang chags pa la mos pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one who is established in attachment has an inclination toward aversion, and one who is established in aversion has an inclination toward attachment.

original: dbang po'i rim pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po tha dad pa nyid de /
analyzed: dbang po'i rim pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po tha dad pa nyid de /
translated: The order of faculties means the distinction of faculties such as faith.

original: 'di ni dbang po rtul po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dbang po rtul po'o //
translated: This one has dull faculties.

original: dbang po 'bring po'o //
analyzed: dbang po 'bring po'o //
translated: This one has middling faculties.

original: dbang po rnon po'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'o //
translated: This one has sharp faculties.üîΩThis one has no faculties.

original: dbang po med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po med pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa ni 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi khams yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang ma nges pa shes pa ni de dag gi rjes su mthun pa'i lam mkhyen cing ston pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa ni btang snyoms su bya ba dang mthun par btang snyoms su byed do //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa ni 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi khams yang dag pa nyid du nges pa dang ma nges pa shes pa ni de dag gi rjes su mthun pa'i lam mkhyen cing ston pa dang / log pa nyid du nges pa ni btang snyoms su bya ba dang mthun par btang snyoms su byed do //
translated: Knowledge of the path going everywhere is as follows: Here a bodhisattva knows the path that is suitable for those beings who are ascertained in reality and those who are not ascertained. He teaches them the path. He is indifferent to those who are wrongly ascertained, and he acts with indifference in a way that is suitable.

original: 'di ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i lam mo //
translated: This is the path that acts as the antidote to attachment.

original: 'di ni zhes sdang gi gnyen por gyur ba'i lam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes sdang gi gnyen por gyur ba'i lam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the path that acts as the antidote to hatred.

original: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The afflictions of meditative absorption, liberation, concentration, and meditative attainment.

original: @113b bsam gtan ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: @113b bsam gtan ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Meditative absorption is the four meditative absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni brgyad do //
translated: Liberation is the eight liberations.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni gsum ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni gsum ste /
translated: Concentration is the three concentrations.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'o //

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu'o //
translated: The meditative attainment is the four formless meditative attainments and the nine successive meditative attainments.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ro myang ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ro myang ba'o //

original: rnam par byang ba ni mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //

original: lhag ma gsum ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //

original: mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi ste /

translated: The fearlessness in perfect enlightenment, the fearlessness in the destruction of the impurities, the fearlessness in the hindrances to the path, and the fearlessness in the path of definite release.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //

analyzed: chos thams cad kyang de bzhin du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na gdams pa 'am thob pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i don to //

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: de la kun brtags dang rnam par brtags pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par bsgrub pa ste /

analyzed: rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //

original: rtag tu de kho na bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu de kho na bzhin du gnas pa'i phyir ro //

original: de la mngon par ma grub pa gang yin pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mngon par ma grub pa gang yin pa de gang zhe na /

original: ci yang med de /
analyzed: ci yang med de /

analyzed: gang yang mngon par ma grub pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid do zhes bya ba ni dgu ba'i don to //
translated: However, it is the reality of the dharmas such as form. This is the meaning of the ninth.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin na de'i tshe ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' mngon par ma grub pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par ma grub pa gdams par bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid yin na de'i tshe ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' mngon par ma grub pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par ma grub pa gdams par bya bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: go rims bzhin du bems po nyid dang / mngon par brjod pa ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bcu pa'i don to //

analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa las gzhan du byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'i don to //

analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bcu gcig mi dmigs pa bstan pa na sems gang bstan pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: mi 'gong ba ni dmigs pa de la bsdus par gyur pa'o //

analyzed: rgod pa ni chags par bya ba'i yul rjes su dran nas 'dod chags kyi char gyur pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /

analyzed: de dag zhi bar bya ba'i phyir yid phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas gdams ngag ni thog mar yongs su shes par bya ba bcu po dag yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //

original: de nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, the aids to penetration are the preparation for the supramundane path.

original: de nas rten ni sgrub pa'i rten te /
analyzed: de nas rten ni sgrub pa'i rten te /
translated: Then, the basis is the basis of practice.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it abandons the grasping of self.

original: de nas dmigs pa ni de la rmongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas dmigs pa ni de la rmongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, the objective is the objective of practice. Because it abandons delusion about that.

original: de nas ched du bya ba ni log pa'i ched du bya ba spangs pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i ched du bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas ched du bya ba ni log pa'i ched du bya ba spangs pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i ched du bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, the purpose is the purpose of practice. Because it abandons the false purpose and knows the nature of the true purpose.

original: de nas sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Then, there are four kinds of practice.üîΩAmong them, the armor practice is the practice of the six perfections, which is the practice of all the perfections at all times.

original: de la sgrub pa gang la bar du gcod par byed pa thams cad so sor bcom pa de ni go cha'i sgrub pa drug go //
analyzed: de la sgrub pa gang la bar du gcod par byed pa thams cad so sor bcom pa de ni go cha'i sgrub pa drug go //
translated: The engagement practice is the practice of the four kinds of thorough searching, which is the practice of the perfections in the form of the four kinds of thorough searching.üîΩThe non-negligence practice is the practice of the four right efforts, which is the practice of the perfections in the form of the four right efforts.üîΩThe non-deficiency practice is the practice of the four bases of magic power, which is the practice of the perfections in the form of the four bases of magic power.üîΩThe non-regression practice is the practice of the five faculties, which is the practice of the perfections in the form of the five faculties.üîΩThe non-submergence practice is the practice of the five powers, which is the practice of the perfections in the form of the five powers.üîΩThe non-distraction practice is the practice of the seven factors of enlightenment, which is the practice of the perfections in the form of the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: gang gi theg pa chen po la 'dzeg par byed pa de ni 'jug pa'i sgrub pa rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: gang gi theg pa chen po la 'dzeg par byed pa de ni 'jug pa'i sgrub pa rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: The non-erroneous practice is the practice of the eightfold noble path, which is the practice of the perfections in the form of the eightfold noble path.

original: gang gis rgyu'i mthar thug pa thob par byed pa de ni tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnam pa bcu bdun no //
analyzed: gang gis rgyu'i mthar thug pa thob par byed pa de ni tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnam pa bcu bdun no //
translated: The accumulation practice is the seventeen practices by which one attains the ultimate cause.

original: gang gis 'bras bu'i mthar thug pas gnon pa de ni nges par byung ba'i sgrub pa brgyad do //
analyzed: gang gis 'bras bu'i mthar thug pas gnon pa de ni nges par byung ba'i sgrub pa brgyad do //
translated: The emergence practice is the eight practices by which one attains the ultimate result.

original: de bas na bzhi po 'di ni sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bzhi po 'di ni sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these four are the practices.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i grangs byas nas bzhi bcur 'gyur ro //üîΩmngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa dag ldan zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i grangs byas nas bzhi bcur 'gyur ro // mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa dag ldan zhes bya ba /

original: rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas sbyar ba las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas sbyar ba las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi le'u ste dang po'o /

original: // / lam shes pa nyid bstan par bya ba la /
analyzed: // / lam shes pa nyid bstan par bya ba la /

analyzed: rung bar ma byas pa la bstan par rigs pa ma yin te /

analyzed: de yang rung bar byas pa nyid ni byang chub kyi sems yin no //
translated: And being a suitable vessel is precisely the thought of awakening.

original: de bas na dang por de nyid @125a * //
analyzed: de bas na dang por de nyid @125a * //
translated: Therefore, first, that itself

analyzed: de ni / lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of making the gods suitable,üîΩhe made them dim with light,

analyzed: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las //

analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: gsungs so zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //

analyzed: lha rnams zhes bya ba ni lha'i tshogs rnams so //

analyzed: rung bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten thams cad zil gyis mnan bar shes nas de'i dngos por sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: koo shi ka de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas skabs 'byed pa yin no //

analyzed: de bas na byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa gang yin pa de dag gis sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rung bar bya ba'i phyir bskyed pa'o //

analyzed: 'od kyis zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyis so //

analyzed: mog mog por mdzad ces bya ba ni gzi med par mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //

original: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //
translated: The method of knowing the path is as follows:

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i dong ma yan chad do //

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //

original: de la sdug bsngal ni rnam pa bzhir yid la ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ni rnam pa bzhir yid la ste /

analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi @125b pa ste /
translated: impermanence, suffering, voidness, and selflessness.

original: go rims bzhin du skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir dang bdag gi mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir dang bdag gi bas stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir dang bdag gi mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyi phyir dang bdag gi bas stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: These are respectively because of being subject to birth and destruction, because of being disagreeable, because of lacking the nature of a self, and because of being empty of a self.

original: de ltar shi ba'i ro la shi ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar shi ba'i ro la shi ba zhes bya ba ste /

original: bdag gi bas stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi bas stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is empty of a self that is its own.

original: kun 'byung ni rnam pa bzhis spang bar 'os par shes par bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun 'byung ni rnam pa bzhis spang bar 'os par shes par bya ba'i don to //
translated: The origination of suffering is to be understood as the fourfold suitability for abandonment.

original: nad dang shu ba dang zug rdu dang sdig pa ste /
analyzed: nad dang shu ba dang zug rdu dang sdig pa ste /
translated: It is a disease, a tumor, a dart, and a calamity.

original: go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir dang / sdug bsngal 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid dang gdon par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'di dang gzhan du sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i chos mthun pa nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid kyi phyir dang / sdug bsngal 'phel bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid dang gdon par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'di dang gzhan du sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i chos mthun pa nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order, because it is the cause of suffering, because it is the cause of the increase of suffering, because it is difficult to remove, and because it is the cause of the similarity of suffering in this life and the next.

original: yang rnam pa bzhis nus pa nyid du yongs su shes pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bzhis nus pa nyid du yongs su shes pa'i don te /
translated: Moreover, the fourfold suitability for abandonment is to be understood as the fourfold suitability for thorough knowledge.

original: pha rol dang 'jig pa'i chos can dang g-yo ba dang rab tu 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol dang 'jig pa'i chos can dang g-yo ba dang rab tu 'jig pa ste /
translated: It is an enemy, a transitory collection, a dart, and a calamity.

original: bdag ni dor bar mi nus pas 'dis ni pha rol lo //
analyzed: bdag ni dor bar mi nus pas 'dis ni pha rol lo //

original: 'jig pa'i chos can ni skad cig ma re rer 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can ni skad cig ma re rer 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is a dart because it is the cause of suffering in this life and the next.

original: g-yo ba ni dgra bcom pa dag gis lam rnam mas rtsa ba nas bton pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni dgra bcom pa dag gis lam rnam mas rtsa ba nas bton pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúMoving‚Äù means that the arhats have completely uprooted the paths of the afflictions.

original: skabs su bab pa'i lam gyis 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i lam gyis 'jig pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu 'jig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCompletely destroyed‚Äù means that the paths that are appropriate to the occasion are destroyed.

original: myur du byed pa'i don yang gsum ste /
analyzed: myur du byed pa'i don yang gsum ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúquickly‚Äù is also threefold:

analyzed: thog 'bab pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jig pa'i rgyud nyid kyi phyir 'jig pa'o // 'byung po dang srin po dang chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir 'go ba'i nad do //
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction‚Äù means that the continuum of destruction is like a flash of lightning, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúEpidemic‚Äù means that it is similar to the bhutas, rakshasas, etc.

original: mu ge dang pha rol gyi dmag tshogs la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: mu ge dang pha rol gyi dmag tshogs la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa nyid kyi phyir 'tshe ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúInvasion‚Äù means that it is similar to famine, foreign armies, etc.üîΩSimilarly, the reverse of dependent origination is stated in the sutra:

original: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs las bzlog pa ni ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs las bzlog pa ni ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ces bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: ‚ÄúThrough the cessation of ignorance, the conditioning factors cease,‚Äù and so on, up to

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: ‚Äúthe great mass of suffering ceases.‚Äù

analyzed: de la nges par 'gog pas na 'gog pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Cessation is so called because it definitely causes cessation.üîΩIt is the truth of cessation.

original: 'dis 'gog par byed pas na 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis 'gog par byed pas na 'gog pa ste /
translated: It is cessation because it causes cessation.

original: lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: It is the truth of the path.

original: de dag so so la yang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de dag so so la yang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: Each of these has seven aspects:

original: bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang ; stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang ; stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: absence of self, peace, isolation, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, and non-fabrication.

original: de la rnal 'byor ba'i bdag ni sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid kyi phung po dag ste /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor ba'i bdag ni sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid kyi phung po dag ste /

analyzed: de bas na sdug bsngal gyi dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir bdag med pa'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba nyid kyi phyir zhi ba'o//
translated: Because of the complete pacification of the afflictions, there is peace.

original: @126a * // de gnyis ni mi gtsang ba ste /
analyzed: @126a * // de gnyis ni mi gtsang ba ste /

original: de dag zad pa nyid kyi phyir dben pa ste /
analyzed: de dag zad pa nyid kyi phyir dben pa ste /
translated: Because of the exhaustion of those two, there is isolation,

original: gtsang pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtsang pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means purity.

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i phyir stong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i phyir stong ba'o //
translated: Because of the absence of self and being mine, there is emptiness.

analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o // khams gsum pa la smon pa ni smon lam ste /

original: de zad pa'i phyir smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de zad pa'i phyir smon pa med pa'o //

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa med pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam pa'o //
