translated: If one finds a world-realm of a billion worlds filled with the relics of the Tathagata, and also a copy of the Perfection of Wisdom, one should take the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: sku gdung bsnyen bkur byas pa las bde 'gro'i bde ba dang / byang chub gsum gyi phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das ma las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sku gdung bsnyen bkur byas pa las bde 'gro'i bde ba dang / byang chub gsum gyi phun sum tshogs pa gang yin pa de bcom ldan 'das ma las byung ba yin te /
translated: The happiness of good destinies and the perfection of the three enlightenments, which come from serving the relics, come from the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das ma la blta ba des sangs rgyas la blta ba ste /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das ma la blta ba des sangs rgyas la blta ba ste /
translated: sees the Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang bcom ldan 'das ma gnyis su med de de dag gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang bcom ldan 'das ma gnyis su med de de dag gnyis su byar med do zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata and the Transcendent Lord are nondual, and they cannot be made dual.üîΩWhoever upholds the Transcendent Lord, bears her in mind, and teaches her extensively to others,

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis bka' yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos ston par mdzad pa dang / gang yang 'ga' zhig bcom ldan 'das ma bzung zhing bcangs la gzhan dag la rgya cher ston pa de ni de dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis bka' yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos ston par mdzad pa dang / gang yang 'ga' zhig bcom ldan 'das ma bzung zhing bcangs la gzhan dag la rgya cher ston pa de ni de dang mnyam ste /
translated: is equal to the Tathagata, the one who teaches the twelve branches of the scriptures through the three kinds of miracles in all the ten directions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang cho 'phrul dang gsung rab dag ni 'di las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang cho 'phrul dang gsung rab dag ni 'di las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata, the miracles, and the scriptures arise from her.

original: gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir sems can rnams kyis 'di 'dzin par 'gyur ba nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i bar du byed pa de la mi dang mi ma yin pas glags rnyed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir sems can rnams kyis 'di 'dzin par 'gyur ba nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i bar du byed pa de la mi dang mi ma yin pas glags rnyed par mi 'gyur /
translated: No human or nonhuman can harm those who take up this discourse, from the beings of this great trichiliocosm on up, who take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, understand it, and attend to it in the correct manner.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma de ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma de ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad par 'gyur /
translated: The Blessed Lady will perform the deeds of a buddha.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams der sangs rgyas 'byung ba blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams der sangs rgyas 'byung ba blta bar bya ste /
translated: One should see the appearance of a buddha in that world system.

original: 'dir dpe ni lha'i nor bu rin po che zhes bya ba ste drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni lha'i nor bu rin po che zhes bya ba ste drug pa'o //
translated: The example here is the divine jewel gem. This is the sixth.

original: gal te gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bltams pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ma glegs bam du bris pa rnyed na bdag ni 'di len to //
analyzed: gal te gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gis byur bur bltams pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ma glegs bam du bris pa rnyed na bdag ni 'di len to //
translated: If I were to find a world system equal to the sands in the Ganges River filled with the bodily remains of the Thus-Gone One and a copy of the Blessed Lady in book form, I would take this.

original: de dag ni de las skyes ba nyid kyis mchod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni de las skyes ba nyid kyis mchod par 'gyur te /
translated: They are worshipped because they are born from it.

original: de mchod pa byas pa las kyang ngan song bcom nas /
analyzed: de mchod pa byas pa las kyang ngan song bcom nas /
translated: And by worshipping it, one destroys the lower realms

original: bde 'gro'i bde ba nyung zad nyams su myong ste /
analyzed: bde 'gro'i bde ba nyung zad nyams su myong ste /
translated: and experiences the little happiness of the happy realms.

original: sdug bsngal mthar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: And one will put an end to suffering.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di bzung ba nas tshul bzhin yid la byas pa'i bar gyis pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di bzung ba nas tshul bzhin yid la byas pa'i bar gyis pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: By upholding this Blessed Lady, and by bringing her to mind properly, one will complete the perfections and so forth, up to the unmixed dharmas,

original: @134b ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa thob nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @134b ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa thob nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing dag tu 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and having attained the superknowledges of a bodhisattva, one will go to the buddhafields.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad blta bar 'dod pas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams bsgom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad blta bar 'dod pas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams bsgom par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
translated: One who wishes to see all the buddhas of the ten directions will meditate on the mindfulness of the Buddha and on conditioned and unconditioned dharmas. This is the seventh.

original: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gang yin pa de thams cad ni kun rdzob tu bcom ldan 'das ma las byung ba yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub gang yin pa de thams cad ni kun rdzob tu bcom ldan 'das ma las byung ba yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: All the enlightenment of the Tathagatas of the three times, and of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, is, relatively, born from the Transcendent Lord, but not ultimately.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das ma gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: For the Transcendent Lord is nondual,

original: cung zad kyang dor ba med cing len pa med do zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad kyang dor ba med cing len pa med do zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: and there is nothing whatsoever to be discarded or taken up. This is the eighth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che ste /
translated: This Transcendent Lord is the jewel of the perfections,

original: gang 'di la spyod pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dag rab tu shes te /
analyzed: gang 'di la spyod pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dag rab tu shes te /
translated: for by practicing it one understands the mental activities of all sentient beings.

original: sems can 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa nas /
analyzed: sems can 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa nas /
translated: One does not apprehend any sentient beings at all,

original: srog dang gso ba dang skyes bu la sogs pa dang / phung po la sogs pa dang / byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: srog dang gso ba dang skyes bu la sogs pa dang / phung po la sogs pa dang / byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du mi dmigs so //
translated: up to one does not apprehend life, nourishment, person, and so on, the aggregates and so on, enlightenment, Buddha, and the qualities of a Buddha.

original: gang gis ngo bo nyid kyi chos sna tshogs shes pa 'dir mi dmigs pa de bas na bcom ldan 'das ma dmigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis ngo bo nyid kyi chos sna tshogs shes pa 'dir mi dmigs pa de bas na bcom ldan 'das ma dmigs pa med pa ste /
translated: Since one does not apprehend any knower of the manifold of entities in this nonapprehension, therefore the Blessed Lady is nonapprehension.

original: de ltar chos thams cad ni ro gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi mos pa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad ni ro gcig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don gyi mos pa dgu pa'o //
translated: Thus, all dharmas are of one taste. This is the ninth devotion to the welfare of others.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa la //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa la //
translated: In the perfection of wisdom

original: mos pa yis ni chos rnams la //
analyzed: mos pa yis ni chos rnams la //
translated: through devotionüîΩone wishes for praise, honor, and acclaim

original: dgu tshan gsum gyis bstod pa dang // bkur ba dang ni bsngags par 'dod //
analyzed: dgu tshan gsum gyis bstod pa dang // bkur ba dang ni bsngags par 'dod //
translated: through the three groups of nine.

original: ces bya ba ni mos pa dang lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mos pa dang lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: This is devotion and intense devotion.

original: cha dang cha shas dang phyogs 'ga' zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: cha dang cha shas dang phyogs 'ga' zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs so //
translated: The parts, portions, and some aspects are synonyms.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pa dgu tshan gsum gyis dbye ba gsungs pa gang yin pa de'i cha rnams la dgu tshan gsum gyis rab tu phye ba dag ni go rims bzhin du bstod pa dang bkur ba dang bsngags pa dag tu 'dod
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pa dgu tshan gsum gyis dbye ba gsungs pa gang yin pa de'i cha rnams la dgu tshan gsum gyis rab tu phye ba dag ni go rims bzhin du bstod pa dang bkur ba dang bsngags pa dag tu 'dod
translated: The divisions of the three groups of nine that were taught in the perfection of wisdom are the parts of those. The three groups of nine are respectively held to be praise, honor, and acclaim.

original: de / byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa rnams la spro bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de / byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa rnams la spro bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to inspire the bodhisattvas to aspire to them.

original: de rnams kyi dgu tshan dang po la ni bstod pa chung du ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dgu tshan dang po la ni bstod pa chung du ste /
translated: The first group of nine is the lesser praise,

original: yang dag pa'i yon tan brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i yon tan brjod pa'o //
translated: the expression of true virtues.

original: de dag nyid kyi gnyis pa la ni bkur ba ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi gnyis pa la ni bkur ba ste /
translated: The second group of nine is the middling praise,üîΩthe expression of the greatness of the virtues.

original: 'bring ngo // de dag nyid kyi gsum pa la ni @135a * //
analyzed: 'bring ngo // de dag nyid kyi gsum pa la ni @135a * //
translated: The third group of nine is the greater praise,

original: bsngags pa ste chen po'o //
analyzed: bsngags pa ste chen po'o //
translated: the expression of the greatness of the greatness of the virtues.

original: gsum po de nyid kyi 'og tu lhag pa dgu tshan gsum gyis brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gsum po de nyid kyi 'og tu lhag pa dgu tshan gsum gyis brjod par bya ste /
translated: After these three groups of nine, the remaining three groups of nine should be expressed.

original: gang gis bcom ldan 'das ma la spyod pa dang mchod pa bdag nyid byed la gang gis de dag glegs bam du bris nas gzhan la byin na 'di nyid snga ma las bsod nams mngon du 'phags te /
analyzed: gang gis bcom ldan 'das ma la spyod pa dang mchod pa bdag nyid byed la gang gis de dag glegs bam du bris nas gzhan la byin na 'di nyid snga ma las bsod nams mngon du 'phags te /
translated: If one practices and worships the Bhagavatƒ´ oneself, and if one writes them out in a book and gives them to others, this very [practice] is superior in merit to the former.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma byin pa ni chos sbyin pa bla na med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstod pa dang po'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma byin pa ni chos sbyin pa bla na med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bstod pa dang po'o //
translated: Because the gift of the Bhagavatƒ´ is the unsurpassed gift of the Dharma. This is the first praise.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma ji skad bstan pa bzhin du gzhan gyi drung du song ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma ji skad bstan pa bzhin du gzhan gyi drung du song ste /
translated: The Blessed Lady, having gone to others as taught,

original: bshad cing bstan pa dang brjod cing bkrol ba dang / rnam par phye ste gsal bar byas na 'di nyid snga ma las bsod nams mang du 'phel te /
analyzed: bshad cing bstan pa dang brjod cing bkrol ba dang / rnam par phye ste gsal bar byas na 'di nyid snga ma las bsod nams mang du 'phel te /
translated: explains, teaches, expresses, elucidates, and clarifies. If one does this, one's merit increases much more than before.

original: de ni ston pa yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ston pa yin no zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be seen as the teacher.

original: ston pa yang gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: ston pa yang gzhan ma yin /
translated: The teacher is not one thing,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma yang gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma yang gzhan ma yin te /
translated: and the Blessed Lady is not another.

original: gang gi phyir 'di nyid la bslabs na byang chub gsum thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bstod pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di nyid la bslabs na byang chub gsum thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bstod pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: Because by training in this alone, one attains the three enlightenments. This is the second praise.

original: sems can gcig cig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can dge dge ba bcu la zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gcig cig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa'i bsod nams gang yin pa de ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can dge dge ba bcu la zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The merit of establishing a single sentient being in the result of stream-entry is greater than the merit of all the sentient beings of Jambudvipa engaging in the ten virtues. This is the third.

original: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Similarly, establishing them in the result of once-returner is the fourth.

original: de bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhes bya pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhes bya pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the fifth is ‚Äúin the fruit of non-returning.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa la zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa la zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the sixth is ‚Äúin the fruit of arhatship.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du rang byang chub la zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang byang chub la zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the seventh is ‚Äúin individual enlightenment.‚Äù

original: gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas /
analyzed: gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas /
translated: The eighth is ‚ÄúIf someone were to establish the sentient beings of Jambudvipa in the fruit of stream-enterer,

original: gang gis sems can gcig cig bla na med pa'i byang chub la bkod pa 'di ni de bas bsod nams ches mang du zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis sems can gcig cig bla na med pa'i byang chub la bkod pa 'di ni de bas bsod nams ches mang du zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: and if someone else were to establish just one sentient being in unexcelled perfect enlightenment, the latter would generate incalculably more merit than the former.‚ÄùüîΩThe ninth is ‚ÄúIf someone were to establish the sentient beings of Jambudvipa in the fruit of once-returner,

original: gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas gang gis sems can gcig cig bla na med pa'i byang chub la bkod pa ni de bas ches bsod nams mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba ni bstod pa dgu
analyzed: gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la bkod pa bas gang gis sems can gcig cig bla na med pa'i byang chub la bkod pa ni de bas ches bsod nams mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba ni bstod pa dgu
translated: and if someone else were to establish just one sentient being in unexcelled perfect enlightenment, the latter would generate incalculably more merit than the former.‚Äù

original: pa'o // gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling bdag phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / gang gis gcig cig bla na med pa'i byang chub la zhes bya ba ni bkur pa dang po'o //
analyzed: pa'o // gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling bdag phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / gang gis gcig cig bla na med pa'i byang chub la zhes bya ba ni bkur pa dang po'o //
translated: The first homage is to the one who has established the world in the fruit of non-returning and who has established a single being in unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling pa dgra bcom pa nyid la zhes bya ba dang / gang gis sems can gcig cig bla na @135b med pa'i byang chub la zhes bya ba ni bkur ba gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling pa dgra bcom pa nyid la zhes bya ba dang / gang gis sems can gcig cig bla na @135b med pa'i byang chub la zhes bya ba ni bkur ba gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second homage is to the one who has established the world in the state of an arhat and who has established a single being in unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling pa rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la zhes bya ba dang gcig cig bla na med pa'i byang chub la zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzam bu'i gling pa rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la zhes bya ba dang gcig cig bla na med pa'i byang chub la zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third homage is to the one who has established the world in the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha and who has established a single being in unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das ma las bstan pa dang gang zag thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang bcom ldan 'das ma las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das ma las bstan pa dang gang zag thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad dang / lha dang mi rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang bcom ldan 'das ma las byung ba yin te /
translated: All uncontaminated dharmas are taught in the Bhagavatƒ´, and all perfections of all persons and all perfections of gods and humans arise from the Bhagavatƒ´.

original: de'i phyir phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag gi sems can la gang yin pas rang byang chub la bkod pa pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs re re zhing gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag gi sems can la gang yin pas rang byang chub la bkod pa pas /
translated: Therefore, compared to someone who establishes as many sentient beings as there are grains of sand in the river Ganges in each of the ten directions in the state of a pratyekabuddha,

original: gzhan gyis bcom ldan 'das ma glegs bam du bris pa yang byas la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bcom ldan 'das ma glegs bam du bris pa yang byas la /
translated: another who writes out the Mother of the Victorious Ones in book form and

original: gzhan la bri ba dang klag pa'i phyir byin na 'di nyid de bas bsod nams mang du 'phel lo //üîΩgang gi pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: gzhan la bri ba dang klag pa'i phyir byin na 'di nyid de bas bsod nams mang du 'phel lo // gang gi pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa nas /
translated: gives it to others to write out and read, this one's merit increases even more.üîΩThe correct mental engagement in the six perfections and so forth

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mthar thug pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mthar thug pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: byang chub la gnyis su spyod pa ma yin pa'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can dag dge ba bcu dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang mngon par shes pa la bkod pa'i bsod nams las ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub la gnyis su spyod pa ma yin pa'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can dag dge ba bcu dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang mngon par shes pa la bkod pa'i bsod nams las ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: Because they do not practice the perfection of wisdom in a dualistic way, they generate much more merit than those who establish the sentient beings of the three-thousand-fold world-realms in the ten virtues, the concentrations, the formless states, the immeasurables, and the superknowledges.

original: gang gis 'di gzhan dag la rgya cher ston par byed la don gtan la 'bebs pa ston par byed de 'di ltar de dag ni gnyis su ma yin gnyis su med par blta bar bya ba ma yin te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis 'di gzhan dag la rgya cher ston par byed la don gtan la 'bebs pa ston par byed de 'di ltar de dag ni gnyis su ma yin gnyis su med par blta bar bya ba ma yin te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who teach this extensively to others and demonstrate the ascertainment of the meaning generate even more merit, because those who do not see things as dual or non-dual do not conceptualize.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa'i mthar ma yin /

analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gzung ba dang de'i ye shes 'dzin par byed pa nyid kyi sgo nas mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de ltar 'phro bar yang mi byed na zhes bya ba ni spros pa gsum po de dag gis te /
analyzed: de ltar 'phro bar yang mi byed na zhes bya ba ni spros pa gsum po de dag gis te /

original: phyin ci log gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyin ci log gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not inverted means that it is not inverted through the three inversions.

original: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
analyzed: kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir de dag ni thams cad shes pa'i mthong ba'i lam la skad cig ma bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir de dag ni thams cad shes pa'i mthong ba'i lam la skad cig ma bcu drug yin no //
translated: Here, those sixteen moments of the path of seeing are complete knowledge.

original: de ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang // yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang // yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
translated: Thus, this, and also this, and also this

analyzed: 'di ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs su bstan pa yin //

original: zhes bya ba la de ltar gyi sgra ni sogs pa'i don te //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de ltar gyi sgra ni sogs pa'i don te //

original: gsum po dag @147a * //üîΩla yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum po dag @147a * // la yang sbyar bar bya'o //

original: yang gi sgra ni dang po la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni dang po la yang sbyar bar bya'o //

original: 'di'i sgra gsum po ni yang gi sgra las 'og tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i sgra gsum po ni yang gi sgra las 'og tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: The three terms here are to be understood from the term ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gsum po zhes bya ba ni lhag pa gsum po dag gis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po zhes bya ba ni lhag pa gsum po dag gis te /
translated: The three aspects are the three remaining ones.

original: 'di ni chos gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is the section beginning with ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, this perfection of wisdom is the unsurpassed protection, the unsurpassed refuge of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings,‚Äù and ending with ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, the perfection of wisdom is the unsurpassed teacher of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs gsum po dag ces bya ba ni bzlog pa'i rim pas thams cad shes pa'i dbang du bya ba dang / lam shes pa'i dbang du bya ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa rdzogs par yongs su bstan cing de dag bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum po dag ces bya ba ni bzlog pa'i rim pas thams cad shes pa'i dbang du bya ba dang / lam shes pa'i dbang du bya ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa rdzogs par yongs su bstan cing de dag bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The three states are the state of the knowledge of all aspects, the state of the knowledge of paths, and the state of the knowledge of bases, which are taught in the reverse order.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas sbyar ba dag ldan zhes bya ba las thams cad shes pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa rin chen 'byung gnas zhi bas sbyar ba dag ldan zhes bya ba las thams cad shes pa zhes bya ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the third chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Knowledge of All Modes,‚Äù from the Ornament of the Scriptures of the Universal Vehicle.

analyzed: // / da ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba yin pa de bas na /

analyzed: gzhi ni dmigs pa ste /

analyzed: bden pa bzhi la sogs pa'o //

original: de'i ye shes kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: de'i ye shes kyi bye brag ste /
translated: The knowledge of that is the particular

original: rnam pa gang dag gis de yongs su shes par bya ba de dag rnam pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag gis de yongs su shes par bya ba de dag rnam pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: aspects, which are the aspects by which it is completely known.

original: / mtshan nyid ni ming ngo //
analyzed: / mtshan nyid ni ming ngo //
translated: The characteristics are the names.

original: kun mkhyen pa dag rnam gsum phyir //üîΩde yang rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: kun mkhyen pa dag rnam gsum phyir // de yang rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: Because of the three omnisciences,

analyzed: ces bya ba la /

analyzed: kun mkhyen pa dag ces bya ba ni rigs kya mang po'i tshig yin te /

analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ; med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ste //
translated: With regard to that, with respect to the state of omniscience,üîΩfrom the aspect of non-existence up to

original: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //
translated: the aspect of non-disturbance,

original: bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam la de ni bco lngar bshad //
analyzed: bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam la de ni bco lngar bshad //
translated: Four in each of the truths, and fifteen in the path.

original: ces bya ba gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ba dang / 'di ni mi g-yo ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa'i bar nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: 'di ni ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ba dang / 'di ni mi g-yo ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa'i bar nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: The perfection of nonexistence is the perfection of the aspect of nonexistence, and so on up to the perfection of nonfluctuation, which is the perfection of the aspect of nonfluctuation.

original: de dag la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa la bzhi bzhi dang / lam gyi bden pa la lhag ma bco lnga'o //
analyzed: de dag la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa la bzhi bzhi dang / lam gyi bden pa la lhag ma bco lnga'o //
translated: There are four in each of the truths of suffering, origin, and cessation, and fifteen in the truth of the path.

original: med pa'i rnam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni med pa'i rnam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i rnam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni med pa'i rnam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the aspect of nonexistence is the perfection of the aspect of nonexistence.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma thams cad la @147b yang ngo ;
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma thams cad la @147b yang ngo ;
translated: And so on for all the others.

original: / de la sdug bsngal gyi gzhi ni med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / dben pa dang / thub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: / de la sdug bsngal gyi gzhi ni med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / dben pa dang / thub pa med pa'o //
translated: The basis of suffering is nonexistence, sameness, isolation, and nonapprehension.

original: med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: Nonexistence is like space, form, and so on.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad dmigs su med pas mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad dmigs su med pas mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Equality is because of the equality of all phenomena such as form, etc., which are not perceived.

original: dben pa ni shin tu stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa ni shin tu stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Isolation is because of the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: thub pa med pa ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thub pa med pa ni chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-apprehension is because of the non-apprehension of all phenomena.

original: kun 'byung gi gzhi ni gnas med pa dang / nam mkha' dang / brjod du med pa dang / ming med pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi gzhi ni gnas med pa dang / nam mkha' dang / brjod du med pa dang / ming med pa'o //
translated: The basis of origination is the absence of a basis, space, the inexpressible, and the absence of a name.

original: gnas med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of a basis is because of the absence of the five aggregates such as form, etc.

original: nam mkha' ni gzugs la sogs pa dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gzugs la sogs pa dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Space is because of the absence of form, etc., which are exhalation and inhalation.

original: brjod du med pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod du med pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inexpressible is because of the non-apprehension of discursive thought and investigation.

original: ming med pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming med pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of a name is because of the non-apprehension of form, feeling, etc.

original: 'gog pa'i bzhi ni 'gro ba med pa dang // gzung du med pa dang / mi zad pa dang / skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bzhi ni 'gro ba med pa dang // gzung du med pa dang / mi zad pa dang / skye ba med pa'o //
translated: The four of cessation are: non-going, non-apprehension, non-exhaustion, and non-arising.

original: 'gog pa'i 'gro ba med pa ni chos thams cad la 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i 'gro ba med pa ni chos thams cad la 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The non-going of cessation is because all dharmas are non-going and because of being naturally liberated.

original: 'gog pa'i gzung du med pa ni chos thams cad gzung du med pa'i phyir chos kyi chos la 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i gzung du med pa ni chos thams cad gzung du med pa'i phyir chos kyi chos la 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of cessation is because all dharmas are non-apprehended, and because the dharma does not apprehend the dharma.

original: mi zad pa ni tshos thams cad shin tu zad cing dengs pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: mi zad pa ni tshos thams cad shin tu zad cing dengs pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Non-exhaustion is because all dharmas are utterly exhausted and extinguished.

original: shin tu zad pa med cing 'gog pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu zad pa med cing 'gog pa med pa nyid do //
translated: It is because of being utterly non-exhausted and non-ceased.

original: skye ba med pa ni chos thams cad skye ba med cing 'gog pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ni chos thams cad skye ba med cing 'gog pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Non-arising is because all dharmas are non-arising and non-ceased.

original: lam gyi bco lnga ni byed pa po med pa dang / shes pa po med pa dang / 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang /
analyzed: lam gyi bco lnga ni byed pa po med pa dang / shes pa po med pa dang / 'pho ba med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / rmi lam dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / smig rgyu dang / sgyu ma dang /
translated: the absence of an agent, the absence of a knower, the absence of transference, the absence of destruction, dreams, echoes, optical illusions, mirages, magical incarnations,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / gos pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / rlom pa med pa dang / g-yo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / gos pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / rlom pa med pa dang / g-yo ba med pa'o //
translated: the absence of affliction, the absence of purification, the absence of bondage, the absence of elaboration, the absence of conceit, and the absence of movement.

original: lam ni byed pa po med pa ste /
analyzed: lam ni byed pa po med pa ste /
translated: The path is without an agent

original: byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because an agent is not perceived.

original: shes pa po med pa ni shes pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa po med pa ni shes pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without a knower because a knower is not perceived.

original: 'pho ba med pa ni skye ba dang 'chi ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'pho ba med pa ni skye ba dang 'chi ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without transference because birth and death are not perceived.

original: 'jig pa med pa ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is without destruction because all phenomena are naturally without destruction.

original: rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Nature is suchness.

original: rmi lam ni rmi lam @148a * //
analyzed: rmi lam ni rmi lam @148a * //
translated: A dream is a dream.

original: mthong ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seen is not perceived.

original: sgra brnyan ni sgrar brjod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra brnyan ni sgrar brjod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: An echo is not perceived as a sound.

original: mig yor ni gzugs dang gzugs brnyan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig yor ni gzugs dang gzugs brnyan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: An optical illusion is not perceived as a form or a reflection.

original: smig rgyu ni chu'i phung po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smig rgyu ni chu'i phung po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A mirage is not perceived as a mass of water.

original: sgyu ma ni de'i rgyu mtshan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma ni de'i rgyu mtshan dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: An illusion is not perceived as its cause.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of defilement is not perceived as the nature of defilement.

original: rnam par byang ba med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of purification is not perceived as a sentient being who is defiled.

original: gos pa med pa ni nam mkha' lta bu'o //üîΩspros pa med pa ni spros pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gos pa med pa ni nam mkha' lta bu'o // spros pa med pa ni spros pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The absence of obscuration is like space.üîΩThe absence of conceptual differentiation is the complete destruction of all conceptual differentiation.

original: rlom pa med pa ni rlom sems thams cad yang dag par bcom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rlom pa med pa ni rlom sems thams cad yang dag par bcom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The absence of pride is the complete destruction of all pride.

original: g-yo ba med pa ni chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa ni chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The unmoving is the aspect of the knowledge of all modes, because it is the very state of the dharma-element.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the knowledge of paths, it is said:üîΩCause, path, suffering, and cessation,

original: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa la ni go rims bzhin //
translated: in order,

original: de ngag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
analyzed: de ngag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
translated: are proclaimed to have eight, seven,

original: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: five, and sixteen aspects.

original: rgyu ni kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu ni kun 'byung ngo //
translated: Cause is origination.

original: de bas na 'dir kun 'byung dang lam dang por gsungs pa ni 'bras bu'i thabs su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir la /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir kun 'byung dang lam dang por gsungs pa ni 'bras bu'i thabs su gyur pa nyid kyi phyir la /
translated: Therefore, here origination and path are stated first, because they are the means to the fruit.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa ni 'bras bur gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Suffering and cessation are the fruit.

original: de dag gi rnam pa go rims bzhin du brgyad dang / bdun dang lnga dang bcu drug ces mdo las gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa go rims bzhin du brgyad dang / bdun dang lnga dang bcu drug ces mdo las gsungs so //
translated: Their aspects are proclaimed in the scriptures to be, in order, eight, seven, five, and sixteen.

original: de la kun 'byung gi brgyad de 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi gnas pa dang / zhi ba dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can med pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun 'byung gi brgyad de 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mi gnas pa dang / zhi ba dang / 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can med pa'o //
translated: The eight of origination are: freedom from desire, non-abiding, peace, non-desire, non-hatred, non-delusion, non-affliction, and non-sentience.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Freedom from desire is due to the non-apprehension of form, etc. as the basis for desire.

original: 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan ni zhen par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rgyu mtshan ni zhen par bya ba'o //
translated: The basis for desire is that which is clung to.

original: gnas ni zhen pa dang / sred pa yin la /
analyzed: gnas ni zhen pa dang / sred pa yin la /
translated: Clinging and craving are the abode.

original: de med pa'i phyir gnas med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir gnas med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since those do not exist, there is no abode, because all phenomena such as form are unapprehendable.

original: zhi ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad phyin ci ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad phyin ci ma log pa'i de bzhin nyid du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Peace is due to the perfect enlightenment of all phenomena such as form in their unmistaken suchness.

original: 'dod chags med pa ni 'dod @148b chags med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa ni 'dod @148b chags med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-desire is due to the absence of desire.

original: zhe sdang med pa ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Absence of hatred is because of the absence of fault.

original: gti mug med pa ni mun pa bcom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni mun pa bcom pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Absence of delusion is because of the destruction of darkness.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni yongs su rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni yongs su rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Absence of defilement is because of the absence of conceptual thought.

original: sems can med pa ni sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can med pa ni sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Absence of sentient beings is because of the non-apprehension of sentient beings.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni tshad med pa dang / mtha' gnyis dang ma 'brel pa dang tha mi dad pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni tshad med pa dang / mtha' gnyis dang ma 'brel pa dang tha mi dad pa dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / chags pa med pa'o //
translated: The truth of the path is immeasurable, not associated with the two extremes, not differentiated, not grasped as supreme, non-conceptual, unfathomable, and unattached.

original: tshad med pa ni chos thams cad las kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni chos thams cad las kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is immeasurable because of the absence of the arising of all phenomena.

original: mtha' gnyis dang ma 'brel pa ni mtha' gnyis dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis dang ma 'brel pa ni mtha' gnyis dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not associated with the two extremes because the two extremes are non-apprehensible.

original: tha mi dad pa ni chos thams cad dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir dang dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ni chos thams cad dbyer med pa nyid kyi phyir dang dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not differentiated because all phenomena are indivisible and secluded.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-reification is the transcendence of the activities of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-conceptuality is the non-apprehension of conceptualization.

original: dpag tu med pa ni chos thams cad kyi tshad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni chos thams cad kyi tshad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Immeasurability is the non-apprehension of the measure of all phenomena.

original: chags pa med pa ni chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa med pa ni chos thams cad nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Non-attachment is the sameness of all phenomena with the nature of space.

original: sdug bsngal gyi lnga ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi lnga ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: The five aspects of suffering are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, selflessness, and the absence of characteristics.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Impermanence is the non-destruction of all phenomena such as form,

original: 'jig pa med pa de nyid ni med pa de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa de nyid ni med pa de nyid kyi phyir mi rtag pa ste /
translated: and that non-destruction is impermanence because it is non-existence.
